36424910.review:
*VERY LONG REVIEW, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED*

Let me first start off by saying this game is 100% a niche game, it is meant for fans of the .hack property and its various adaptations. That is not to say that people who dont know the .hack brand will not enjoy this game but it will be very hard to overlook its many flaws. 

1. This game is a set of 3 games + an epilouge (which is brand new I might add), which originally were released back in 2006-2008, they were originally on the ps2 and were fairly advanced for the standards back then, with some truly impressive graphics for the pre-rendered scenes and even the character models were nicely designed (for some of the up-close shots).

2. This game is very dated in its design. It captures the essense of playing a "single-player" MMO perfectly. You are an average person playing this fictional game. But that in and of itself brings about some odd continuity problems. Such as having to log out of the game to check email, then logging back into the game immediately for a cut scene and then logging out to check email again. The progression is OK by 2006 standards, but very archaic by 2017 standards (which is where the game is supposed to take place as an odd twist of fate)

3. Combat is repetitive. sure, this could be said for every game for the most part, but in .hack its especially so. Since the game is modeled after an MMO, which is by nature repetitive, it does take a while for the combat to pick up, and once you have unlocked everything thats it, there is nothing else to get. Combat revolves around mashing or holding the X (A for you Xbox pad players) and occasionally hitting R1 (right bumper) to activate a skill. The battles are highly skewed in the player's favor, with time coming to a complete stop during these skills and being completely invulnerable during thier animations. This is somewhat alleviated in volumes 2 and 3 with some very smart additions, but it does not take away from the simplicity of the combat. It is nowhere near as rediculous as the first set of .hack games (original quadrilogy), but its got its share of problems. thankfully theyve fixed a number of them with this re-release.

4. Story and Voice acting. This game has some very high production values, but there was something they could not avoid when they were re-releasing this and that was how voiceovers were handled. Because of how the old games were formatted in a 4:3 aspect ratio, the subtitles were done in such a way that they would constantly cut people off the in the middle of sentences, the middle of thoughts and it would just sound awkward if you read the line in its entirety. Since they did not go back and re-record the voies for 10 year old games, there are absolutely spots in the game where the voice acting is slow, and plodding, and the tone is not quite right. But there are also spots where the emotion of the characters is properly conveyed because the voice cast is very very high quality.  The story itself is hit or miss. You will either be completely on board with this non-sensical way of handling computer data and dealing with viruses and bugs. or you will not be impressed by the intersocial aspect of how this game handles its characters. But one thing this game does very well is character development. Main and side characters all get some kind of development, with haseo being the best example. 

5. Remake quality. As a fan of the original series and someone who played the games on ps2 to death, i can say that this game does the originals justice by fixing some issues with translations, fixing alot of gameplay issues, but it does bring up a few new ones. Simply because of how easy it is to level and how much more damage you do to enemies, some fights have lost thier challenge, and its easier than ever to over-level and completely trivialize the game. However, a big problem I personally found was that since on the ps2 you had alot of time in between releases to grind out weapon proficiencies, it was very easy in the re-release to be UNDER leveled in those areas. Sure you'd be capped out in the game but you'd be using weaponskills from the beginning of the game still because you blew through it so fast. 

In most cases this would not be an issue but it does take away from the joy of being "well prepared" for the subsequent volumes. You could very well grind out weapons and stuff before progressing but the allure of the story (at least for me) was too powerful for me to consider dumping extra time into the older volumes, espeically considering I knew where the story was going and what to expect. 

In terms of how well the game performs on PC, I give it an A-. I had one problem with a bug during my play time that cost me an hour, but after that I never encountered a bug again. Load times were fast, and I played the game on the highest settings I could achieve through the game without mods (however I did mod in Playstation button icons, why this was not an OPTION at the very least is criminal) .

There are many issues with .hack as a series. But this set of games is completely and fully enjoyable if you are looking to get yourself lost in a self contained story, with compitent but repetitive combat, and un-even voice acting.

36422464.review:
After over 20 hours of playing this game, I have to say I have rather mixed feelings about this. Story isn't so bad, after completing the first part (Rebirth), it has me hooked. Music is nice and main characters are well written (though I have to say some are obnoxious.) I play using japanese dub, because english voices are cringy at best. 

The AI on my companions SUCK during battles. The only wise choice to have is to put them on rage mode, and heal as necessary yourself. In Infection/Mutation/Outbreak/Quarantine, there were several different presets you could command your companions with, now it's either put them on a free running mode (Free-will) all out berserk (Rage) or hit, heal (occasionally) and run (Life). Really? What happened to the other options? Like attack if healing is not needed (Support)? If you could do it before, on PS2, why not now? Seriously.... 

Oh, before anyone starts b1tching about anything, I have never played G.U on PS2, so I don't know how things worked in that version. 

//Edit 12th Nov -17// One other thing that bothered me the most is the fact that there is no option to skip the little cut scenes that occur when you move into a trap room (doors close and the camera shows you the mechanism to release it. I get it the first time, I don't need to be reminded of it 10 times in one dungeon, alright?!) or you get all the pieces of the symbols that opens the door to the temple. I get it from the first time, I don't need to see the door open EVERY single time I clear an area. I understand the point in this is to simulate the game within a game, but even so, it just gets old... and annoying.

//Edit 27th Nov 2017// Okay, after completing the story of the three first games, I'm very annoyed. The story is... forgettable (really, I don't remember what happened in Part 1 and part 2 even if I just played them through. All I can remember are the tedious boss fights in your avatar form. Also.... this game should be called DOTHACK//Holding Hand. Because everytime you arrive in a town, or something, and there's a major event in the main story, you're reminded of it CONSTANTLY. I heard you the first time around, I don't need to be reminded of what I need to do. Besides I can always check my Memoir if I can't remember what I'm supposed to do. Geez. 
But even so, I may be nitpicking things... but I still liked this game. Sadly it is a medicore action hack and slash mystery RPG, a videogame where you play a videogame. 

Bandai, please. Import .Hack//Infection, Mutation, Ourbreak and Quarantine to PC. Please? Pretty please? It was better than this.

But enough about that. 

TL:DR: Despite its flaws I enjoyed this game. You get a lot of action, average story with excellent voice acting (I'm talking about the japanese voice over, of course) and good music.

36404093.review:
(For reference, I have played Volume 1 and am currently on Volume 2. I wanted to wait until I had completed one game before posting a review, so I could give what I feel to be a fair assessment. I played the original games years ago on the PS2.)

Like many others, this was a guranteed buy to me for nostalgia bucks. .hack was a major interest of mine ten years ago, and after .hack as a franchise being in stagnation for years, words couldn't describe my happiness at learning these games were being re-released, remastered, and even getting a fourth installment. But, you know, we live in an era where Mighty No 9 happened. Not to mention a lot of talk about "dumbing down" from the old games (hint: it wasn't dumbing down).

I'll go on about this, but for now here's a tl;dr: it's just as enjoyable as it was back then, looks better (mostly), and gameplay wise is vritually indistinguishable despite it's changes. I will not talk too much about the plot or core gameplay, other than this is a surprisingly story-heavy game for those of you who are not familiar with .hack, and it's gameplay can best be described as solid hack-and-slash, in my opinion. It is an EXTREMELY fun game to play, and a very fun universe to unravel and learn as well. Rather, I want to talk about the derisive changes people are debating, as well as some issues people are having with the game lagging or not starting up.

Let's start talking about some of the gameplay changes:

>Attacks deal more damage
>More EXP
>Retry function
>Chim Sphere cap increased
>Bullets faster in avatar battles
>Reduction in hitstop and battle tempo inscreased
>Cheat mode
>Movement speed increased

In conclusion, after playing Volume 1: virtually nothing has changed between now and the PS2 with these functions in mind.

Go into a high level area well before your time? It's not gonna save you. Infinite retires can't save you whene very enemy oneshots you. The reality is this: G.U. was never hard franchise. When I was only 13-15, outside of Doppelganger fights (mostly because I was really dumb in how I approached them back then), I don't think I got more than five game overs as a child. If I did, it definitely wasn't more than 10 (excluding the final Avatar battle of Vol 3, which I doubt will give me as much issues these times).

These changes were not "dumbing it down" it's making the game go faster. The difficulty is roughly the same as back then. To clarify what this means, the game has greatly increased in it's speed, which is a boon as the PS2 versions sometimes... slagged a bit. Level grinding (btw, G.U. to this day remains the only game I enjoy level grinding in) is less tedious if you aim to go that route (I can't help but reccomend trying to "stay" at story-level to keep some fun bosses being a cakewalk, but it's usually not that bad). Clearing areas is quicker, and it definitely does not feel easier than before, granted it already wasn't hard.

If you find Last Recode easy, you'll find the originals easy too.

"Dumbing down," is an immensely annoying phrase that's entered gamer lingo, one that is tossed at this game often before it was even relased, which is disheartning. This is not a game that has experienced of it: these changes make the game a little less slow and tedious, not "dumb it down for casuals." If you could play G.U. back then, you can play it now. Having more Chim Spheres is good: you can stock up on them for long dungeons where you don't care about the Chim reward for a mission rank and you just want to level up or get the beast statue treasure. I doubt you'll need retries, but at least the option is there. If you bit more than you can handle and you want to Retry just so you can use a smoke screen and not lose your progress?

It's a video game. Do what you want if it's fun! You want to use cheat mode? You bought the damn game, go nuts if it lets you have fun.

If anything, I'm disappointed they didn't change how Duel Swords and Broadswords function in Vol 1. In pre-release material it was reported that "Improvements that were made in Vol. 2: Reminisce and Vol. 3: Redemption will be reflected on Vol. 1: Rebirth in the HD Remaster." You know, maybe this one IS just me not remembering, but quite frankly? I don't see ANY changes. Duel Swords still only combo 3-4 hits, and you still can't move while charging a power attack with a Broadsword in Volume 1. While it was still immensely fun to play after so many years, I can't help but see myself not returning very often to Volume 1 as a result, sadly. I still cannot speak negative of it: while the beginning of Volume 1 is still a bit slow in my opinion, that's a story issue and not a gameplay one.

The graphics are something else I've seen some people mixed on. It's important to remember this is not a remake: it's an HD remaster. They took the old graphics and booted them up to 1080p and made them prettier. It's still a ten year old PS2 game though.

I will comment on Vol 4's graphics when I get there.

Yes, there's some clipping issues. Sometimes it's very blocky, and doesn't look too great at times. Something I had never noticed when I was younger actually is the fact that in a lot of cutscenes, lots of people's mouths didn't move. Probalby a mixture of me being directly at my screen unlike the PS2 days with some distance and being 1080p. So don't expect this looking like a game made brand-new from scratch during 2016-2017. It's not, and it's on you if you're expecting the best visually looking game ever made.

There are two issues I have heard people talk about, and I will give my opinion on both:

>Unusually high lag
>Doesn't seem to start up

I admittingly at first had a lag issue, even with all graphics set to low. I was surprised as this is a good gaming laptop that can play Dark Souls 3 at high graphics with relatively little problem. However, I have a laptop with Nvidia: after doing a little fix (I have posted about this in discussions) I was able to discover this was an issue with Nvidia chosing not to run the game on high settings for some reason. After that, the game runs fun on high graphics, and my girlfriend with a good PC has no issues either.

It's weird, but I think it's more of a "you" issue than a bad port. Still, more than one person has reported such issues, so I suppose beware: in a worst case scenario, don't play more than two hours if you cannot get it to work at all.

I don't know this issue with the game just not starting or crashing. Again, neither me nor anyone I know who has played this game has had this issue. I want to say it's a "you" problem, but more than one person has happened. Saddly, I can offer no real input or advise on it.

In conclusion?

I love this. I loved it back then, and I love it now. I was genuinely happy to buy this game, and I'm genuinely happy to play it. If you'd liek a story-driven anime hack-and-slash with a plot, character evolution (one of the most important things by far is how much Haseo grows up between Volumes 1 and 3 from this edgelord seeking revenge to someone who truly cares for his friends, and Atoli's progression from a doormat into a woman who can stand on her own and even confront the one who ruined her life), a fantastic universe with commentary on the rise of the internet era and the internet's impact on the real world, then I cannot express my encouragement to play this game.

If you are a returning player, then welcome back. 'The World' is ready for you, with a brand new adventure to boot.

And if you are a new player, one who is interested in .hack because you heard about it but could never find a way to play it before (PS2 exclusives each worth a fortune), wanted to play it because you wanted to play the OG "this setting is about an MMORPG that's scewing up the real world," because you're a fan of SAO and wanted to try something you think is similar, or because you hated SAO and heard this was a better version?

Welcome to 'The World.'

Do I recommend this game? Oh yes, I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys JRPG's and the idea of a VR MMO.

This is game is very interesting, and having to actually log out of the game and check your mail, respond to messages (even in forums) and getting to know some of the characters is very fun. The combat is action-packed and satisfying.

You may not like the main character in the beginning, but I feel that as we progress, he will begin to change and Grow Up (G.U heh) and become more likeable.

As of writing this review, I have only finished playing the first Volume of three and a fourth but much shorter one, however this is completely brand new original content.

It has taken me over 45 hours to finish the main story of the first volume and do all of the side stuff it has to offer. I now have two more whole volumes to do as well as the new fourth. For £39.99, you are definitely getting your money's worth!

36389022.review:
非常感動居然出了重製版，當年PS2版玩了很久的，很喜歡的作品之一，為此也寫一個評論吧。

前提：雖然重製版沒有中文字幕，但稍微懂一點日文或者英文都可以看得懂劇情。（據說已經有漢化組接手了，中文字幕版應該不久之後就會出現）而它雖然只是10年前的作品重製版，但即使放到現在也不比任何動漫風格的遊戲差，它絕對還是一款佳作，強烈推薦。（想先看遊戲系統的玩家請先往下部分的內容看，上部分屬於介紹）

------------------------------------------------------------------

遊戲介紹：

.hack系列是以網絡遊戲世界「The World 」為舞台，其中推出了包括遊戲、動畫、小說、漫畫和電影等。設定上可說是類似SAO一樣的世界觀，甚至也有人說SAO是抄.hack的，因為.hack系列比SAO要早發佈一點，雖然實際相差並不久。而人氣方面沒SAO那麼高是因為沒那麼多後宮劇情嘛，但論劇情來說個人覺得.hack系列是更勝一籌的。

而本作.hack//G.U.則是.hack系列裡的第二期作品，包括於2006-2007年在PS2平台發佈的.hack//G.U.三部曲和動畫.hack//Roots等等。

G.U.故事設定於2017年，而由於2010年所發生的事件（指第一期.hack發生的事情），導致「The World 」伺服器停止服務，從而推出了全新續作「The World R:2」，而R:2與前作不同的是解禁了PK（Player Killer，專門攻擊玩家）的行為，從而導致遊戲逐漸出現老手欺負新手的行為，變成互相PK的情況。而主角ハセヲ（Haseo， 長谷雄）便是在剛以新手玩家的身份加入遊戲時，被兩位專門狩獵新手玩家的PK進行了PK的洗禮，此時主角被オーヴァン（Ovan， 歐凡）救了。然後過了8個月，主角的夥伴志乃（Shino）被三爪痕（Tri-Edge）PK，變成了未歸還者（指在現實世界裡失去意識的玩家）。而為了尋找回復志乃的方法，主角不得不去尋找三爪痕，因而不斷作出PKK（Player Killer Killer，專門攻擊PK玩家）的行為來尋找三爪痕的下落，被人稱作「死の恐怖」。後來主角在大聖堂遇見三爪痕，雖然主角等級很高很強大，但只抱著復仇心態的他並不能打倒三爪痕，然後被三爪痕PK時受到了叫作データドレイン（DataDrain）的攻擊，使人物被初始化還原成等級1的狀態。面對著被初始化的衝擊，主角為了拯救志乃，還是選擇了苦難和真理的道路，再次登入了遊戲，從頭開始，而G.U.的故事亦由此開始。

而動畫Roots的劇情則是在遊戲G.U.序幕里提及的那8個月期間所發生的事（簡單來說就是主角在序幕裡被PK之後如何成為「死の恐怖」的劇情），詳情想了解可以去看一次Roots再玩本作（不過不看也不會對本作劇情的了解有很大影響，只是會導致看不懂一小部分劇情的伏筆，比如說「黄昏の旅団」的出處之類的）。

此外G.U.還有一套電影叫作.hack//G.U. Trilogy，於2008年推出，是G.U.遊戲三部曲的劇情濃縮集合版，有興趣也可以去看看（當然建議玩完遊戲再看，不過電影實在省略了許多遊戲劇情，所以也不會劇透很多）。

最後則是G.U.的重頭戲，.hack//G.U. Last Recode/Vol.4 あるいは世界を紡ぐ蛇たちの見る夢，也就是現在說的這款為了紀念15週年，在PS4/PC於2017年推出的重製版遊戲，包含了Vol.1-3的劇情之外再加以收錄新的劇情。

------------------------------------------------------------------

遊戲系統：

·簡單來說是一款3D的RPG遊戲，但主角設定為網絡遊戲的玩家，能夠登出登入「The World 」（遊戲內遊戲的名稱）。

·在「The World 」的世界裡，有各種武器、裝備、物品和技能，HP、SP、能力值、經驗值和金錢等等的屬性。玩家主要活動在タウン（Town，主城鎮）和不同的エリア（Area，副本），而最多可與同伴組成三人パーティー（Party，小組），去遊玩不同的副本關卡。

·タウン就是像玩家據點一樣的地方，這裡沒有打鬥場面，可以購買各種物品和裝備，接受任務和與NPC談話等等。而隨著故事的發展，主角會去到幾個不同的タウン，它們以等級區分。此外タウン還有@Home功能，提供倉庫、鍊金等功能，隨著遊戲劇情發展可用的機能會越來越多。

·エリア就是所謂的副本，遊戲內每個エリア都會以三個選項+タウン等級來產生，不同的エリア有不同的等級和地貌，其中也會出現不同屬性的怪物和寶箱等級等等，而遊戲主線劇情會提供固定的エリア來指示玩家來發展下一步劇情，相對在自由行動的情況下玩家可隨意組成不同的エリア來遊玩，提升等級和能力值等等。

·而主角登出遊戲後，便回到ALTIMIT OS（遊戲內OS的名稱）。在ALTIMIT OS系統裡，玩家可以查閱郵件，主線劇情大多數都要靠查閱新郵件來發展。OS也設有News和BBS系統，多數都是用來簡介「The World 」裡面的世界觀和各種討論（部分還會討論到現實生活）。此外玩家也可設定各種不同的壁紙和音樂，收集壁紙和音樂要靠在「The World 」收集不同的物資來達成。也有影片播放和存檔功能等等。

對於沒接觸過的玩家，如果從頭由Vol.1開始玩可能會覺得遊戲性不大，但去到後期Vol.2、Vol.3就會有更多元素，而如果是收集控的玩家務必要先把Vol.1的元素全部收集完成再去Vol.2，不然在Vol.2的時候很多東西就沒法收集了，同樣2去3也是一樣。

------------------------------------------------------------------

重製版的特性：

重製版的畫質對比於當年的PS2版提升很大，主要有以下幾點：

·畫面解像度提升至1080P/4K程度，從4:3改成了16:9，貼圖畫質大幅提升
·全程穩定60FPS，PS2版由於機能限制並不能穩定
·提升了CG動畫的解像度
·背景和UI全部高清化
·人物增加高清陰影，PS2版不存在陰影的
（吐槽：雖然貼圖畫質提升很大，但看起來還是有點古老，不過光影和高清UI的存在算是順利地改善了這個問題。）

遊戲系統比較與PS2版亦有追加/改變的地方，主要有以下幾點：

·追加チートモード（Cheat Mode，作弊模式）：遊戲開始時便是最強狀態，以便於想欣賞劇情故事的玩家
·追加リトライ（Retry，重新挑戰）：戰鬥失敗時不再是直接Game Over，而是有Retry的選項，而且每次Retry時內部都會自動校正敵人的難度，使敵人更易打敗
·移動速度提升，更利於探索不同地方
·提升我方攻擊力
·減少被命中時的停頓時間，提高戰鬥速度
·提升獲得的經驗值
·最大存檔數量由7增加到20
·物品和裝備數量上限由30增加到90
·單個物品數量上限由50增加到99
·チム玉、ウィルスコア（遊戲內的一些重要物品）上限由99增加到999
此外還有很多其他提升遊戲性的改變，詳情可以在遊戲官網見到。
（吐槽：雖然能明顯感到移動速度提升了，大概有20%左右吧，但個人覺得還是跑得很慢就是了。至於攻擊力提升有點多餘，我反而覺得攻擊力本來就有點高。至於提升戰鬥速度是挺好的，爽快度更高。總括來說大多數都是一些降低遊戲難度的改變就是了。至於其他各類提升物品上限的改變是挺有用的，特別是以前物品上限只有30個的時候總是不夠位置放東西，現在就沒這個問題了）

總括而言，這些改變無論對於新人還是老粉絲來說都是只有好處沒有壞處，也使這遊戲更加完美地呈現在各位玩家面前。

------------------------------------------------------------------

其他：

部分Windows 10用戶可能會遇到進入遊戲10-15分鐘就停止回應的情況，此時只要打開工作管理員把Tabtips.exe結束工作便沒事了，目前不知官方會否修復此問題。

附上一個日本攻略網站，適合各種強迫症的玩家：http://omoteura.com/hackgu/

此外還有一個把遊戲內Xbox UI圖標改成PS UI的mod：https://www.nexusmods.com/hacklastrecode/mods/2/?tab=1&navtag=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fhacklastrecode%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D2%26preview%3D&pUp=1

Vol.1-3全通關加看劇情大概要花50-70小時左右，而要收集全元素要另外多花40-60小時左右，目前本人還沒打到Vol.4，但看起來劇情沒前三部那麼長，大概多花10小時就可以玩完，總數大概花100-140小時就可以通關了，這麼划算的價錢買這麼長的劇情，你絕對不能錯過！

36366395.review:
While I love everything about the game and the nostalgia it's bringing me, the fact that the thing continiously crashes on me is really bringing me to stop trying with it.

The graphics look bad? That's not my issue, graphics don't matter if a game is good or bad.
Clipping? Meh, not really bothered by it. 
Constant crashing for no apparent reason within 15 minutes of starting the game up?
That's just me being unable to enjoy the game. And until that's fixed, thumbs down.

And of course it's not the game, it's my computer. Mine and plenty of others having this issue, who have attacked the problem as a community to try and fix just what's going on, but nothing seems to work.

EDIT: So the reason for the crashing isn't the game, nor is it my computer. Or maybe it is.
It's a conflict between the controller, the game, and Steam Overlay. 
Deleating GameOverlayRenderer64.dll actually ended up fixing all my issues, and then some.

So now I can give this a thumbs up and play for more than 20 minutes without crashing. Huzzah.

36353367.review:
This is the first review I've ever felt like I needed/wanted to write. This is a fantastic port with great touch up work done to make it look pretty. They did some minor tweaks to exp gain, and enemy AI, party members seem a lot more responsive than I remember them being on ps2 regarding their healing as well. Overall, this has been a very welcome release. for the price being asked, you get 3 remastered games, 1 new game (Volume 4: Reconnect was never released until Recode), the Terminal Disc (A series of videos that were previously only available by preordering GU Volume 1), and a parody mode video. 

This game can easily give you 100 hours of playtime if you're going to complete every quest, complete the ryu books in each volume, max friendship totals, etc in each game. I've throughly enjoyed this game, and my close friends have loved seeing the story play out on my streams of it. Characters are great, design of towns, and dungeons are gorgeous, combat, both player and Avatar battles are intuitive and fun.

36353111.review:
.hack// as a series has always been on the top of my lists because the whole concept of "The World" is based in our near future of video games. What a cool concept! To play the future of video games, today! But then the plot develops and you get caught in a storm of both wonderful and scary events. The series is, without a doubt, unique in its origins. And .hack//G.U. Last Recode brings with it the remastering of this unique origin. It reinvigorates a formula that has been worked hard by the series and, in many ways, hit a very high point with the G.U. Vol 1 - 3 on the Sony PS2. Finally having these three volumes and an extra one to boot for the PC is an amazing opportunity and I for one find this entire journey nostalgic in the very best of ways and would love to hear about more people picking it up for the first time so they too can experience the joys and wonders of 'The World'.

Having been playing it again I find it so relaxing to take my time and 100% each volume; its as complete as I remember and I've even taken more time to find "bugs" which fit well once you get deeper into the storyline, very nice touches by the devs I never caught before!

36342310.review:
이 게임은 15주년 기념 리마스터판이고 게임사의 기념비적인, 팬층을 대상으로 제작되어진 것입니다. 플스2 때 나온 원작의 시스템을 그대로 가져왔기 때문에 현세대 유저들에게는 다소 부족한면이 보일 수 밖에 없다고 생각되어집니다.  '메타크리틱'의 점수대를 고려해서 구매하시기보단 최소한 .hack시리즈 중 하나를 감상해보시고 세계관이 맘에 들었을 때 구매하시는걸 추천드립니다.

부연설명을 위해서 전작인
.hack 오리지날 (Vol.1감염확산,Vol.2악성변이,Vol.3침식오염,Vol.4절대포위), 
.hack//SIGN - 닷핵 오리지날과 동시 방영된 애니메이션.
Another Birth - 오리지날 게임과 동시대에 일어난 사건을 다른인물(블랙로즈) 시점에서 서술한 소설,
.hack//G.U. Roots - G.U.와 동시 방영된 애니메이션이며 주인공의 과거 플레이 이력이 담긴 애니메이션.

아래 링크는 추가적으로 G.U.이전의 내용들이 담겨있는 것들이 정리된 글 입니다.
http://bbs.ruliweb.com/game/pc/84543/board/read/9413445?

커뮤니티 닷핵 (작품을 보지않고 대략적인 내용을 유추하고싶다 하시는 분들은 아래 링크)
http://dothack.co.kr/xe

애니, 소설, 만화는 어찌저찌 인터넷 상에서 구한다 쳐도 오리지날 게임은 희소성이 높아져서 매우 구하기가 어려워졌습니다.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 학생 때는 정발이 안 된 게임이여서 한편당 7만원이란 거금이 들어갔던 게임입니다.
전 친구껄 빌려다 했지만.. 게임성도 플스2 당시에는 훌륭했고 그래픽 또한 훌륭했습니다.
스토리도 이세계물(?)로는 당시에 센세이션해서 빠져들기 좋았고, 캐릭터성도 좋습니다.
이게 다 과거형이지만.. 확실히 구매층은 추억의 향수 때문에 사는 팬층일거 같네요.
일단 이정도로 과거이력을 마치고 현 시각에 맞춰 개인적인 스코어를 주자면..


기존 작을 해본 유저들의 위해 '치트 모드'로 전작들을 빠르게 플레이 할 수 있게 되어있습니다.
처음 하시는분이라면 '노말 모드'로 선택 플레이.

스토리/몰입도 ★★★★☆
지금에 와서는 흔하디 흔한 분류여서 어찌보면 '뭐야, 소아온류?'라고 생각하시겠지만 
닷핵이 게임 판타지로서는 시초면서도 스토리 구성도 탄탄합니다.
게임 속의 게임이 있는 내용이고 게임 상에서 OS(운영체제) 바탕화면도 있어서 배경화면, BGM편집도 가능합니다. 가상의 세계에서 일어나는 사건사고를 애니메이션으로 감상 가능(뉴스, 미디어)하기 때문에 몰입도를 한 층 높여주며 구성이 좋습니다.
스토리는 주인공이 과거에 속해 있던 길드, '황혼의 여단'의 멤버 중 유독 유대가 깊었던  '시노(Shino)'라는 플레이어가 미지의 플레이어와 만나  바이러스 버그가 담긴 기술 의해 의식(뇌, 시냅스 간섭)이 잠식당해 '미귀환자'가 되면서 이야기가 시작됩니다(.hack//G.U. Roots내용).

Vol.4로 확장되어 스토리부분에서는 리마스터지만서도 +요소
그리고 업적/트로피 시스템은 플스2 당시엔 없었지만 스팀/PS4판으로 나오면서 추가되어 +요소

캐릭터성 ★★★★★
주인공이 사악함.. 

그래픽 ★★★☆☆ 
당시에는 좋았습니다.. 예.. 그래도 중간중간의 컷씬은 아직까지 볼만하다고 생각되어집니다
카툰그래픽 연출로 알아주는 CyberConnect2가 만들었습니다
대표적으로 나루토밋스톰 시리즈

사운드 ★★★★☆ - 보컬송이 압권 + 성우(거의 풀보이스 지원) 

※ 일본 애니에 익숙하다면 거의 풀보이스 지원하는 게임이라서 한패없이도 할만하다고 생각합니다.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
문제점
약간의 '화면 일그러짐'이랄까 일부 필드에선 바닥부분에 이런현상이 있습니다.
버그는 아직까지 경험해보지 못 했습니다. 리메이크되어도 될법한데 리마스터라서 해상도지원하는 부분에서 그친게 아쉽습니다

36337167.review:
A solid port of a classic RPG series. As a veteran of the games, it took me 16 hours to beat Vol. 1's main story, plus an additional 10 hours of (fairly repetitive) grinding for 100%. My playtimes for the other volumes were:
Vol. 2: Beat the game- 25 Hours. 100%- 38 Hours.
Vol. 3: Beat the game- 22 Hours. 100%- 45 Hours.
Vol. 4: Beat the game- 3 Hours.
Total: Approx. 112 Hours.
Again, I'm a veteran, so if you're new to these games and want to go for 100%, you should probably expect 120+ hours of playtime across all 4 volumes.
 (You may notice my actual playtime is higher, I played through Vol. 1 a second time on release for a stream.)

A few comments, take them as you will:
-Except in certain instances, characters' mouths do not move when they talk.
-There are a few very minor glitches and I have experienced the occasional crash while playing; not nearly enough to stop me from continuing.
-The previously-limited-edition Terminal Disc is included, which will help bring you up to speed on the lore and the story of the original series for new players, and expand on the existing lore for veterans.
-The trailers claim to have taken the various improvements made in Volumes 2 and 3 and applied them to the first game. This is only partially true; some features from the 2nd and 3rd Volumes are still not present in Vol. 1, such as the improved combo mechanics of the twin blades or better charge attacks of the broadsword, or, perhaps most importantly, the quick-switch mechanic.
-Some of the Bonus Content cutscenes (Terminal Disc included) are not updated to HD, and are displayed in a small window within the game. This does not apply to the cutscenes seen throughout the games themselves; only the extra ones you unlock at the end.
-The game's EXP, Skill Points, and Attack Power have been rebalanced to provide a much smoother leveling curve. This version, therefore, is much easier than the originals.
-Features a "Cheat Mode" that allows you to play through the story at max level. Considering the point above, this is mostly inconsequential, as you will rarely have to grind in a normal playthrough anyway.
-Textures and models still look decidedly old, but passable. The lighting engine and cel-shading go a long way to help this.
-The game was made for the PS2, as such it is meant to be played with a controller. It does support DirectInput, as well as all the modern controller APIs.
-Keyboard controls can be re-mapped, but mouse and controller cannot.
-There are 6 new BGMs (available in Vol. 4) and a total of 31 new Backgrounds (Throughout all 4 volumes) that can be used to customize your ingame Desktop. The original Desktop Backgrounds are not updated to the new widescreen format, and are letterboxed in order to maintain their original aspect ratio.

Volume 4 is EXTREMELY short, and many of the features of the first 3 volumes are missing. It is entirely focused on the story, with the only side-content being one final dungeon after beating the game. Its story and presentation are decent, but because of the short runtime it falls flat in my opinion.

The game also features "Parody Mode", a series of cutscenes from the games with edited dialogue. It's probably the best new addition in Last Recode, to be honest.

All-in-all, I think this collection has been well worth my $50 so far, if only for the first three volumes.

(Edit: Updated to reflect my playthroughs of the second, third, and fourth volumes.)

36336728.review:
I reasonably well done remaster of a great trilogy originaly designed for playstation. A few things did happen to be lost in translation, however, which causes the game to behave quite differently in some parts and its very obvious if you have played the originals. Overall, definately worth getting if you liked the original series and want to play on the PC. Below is my list detailing all the faults and counterrarguments I've noticed so far. If you've never played this series, I would definately suggest this purchase! If you already have a way of playing the original, I would probably say stick with the original unless the convenience of having it on PC is desired.

Because the game actually runs faster than it did on the playstation, the beast awakening is quite hard to use because the faster attack speed causes you to drop combos very often unless you are outright mashing the button.

The voices and sound affects were changed slightly, which annoys me personally.

The increased graphical quality makes the lack of detail in the faces of many character models painfully obvious, which i guess overall is good?

The game tends to crash and cause a lot of problems with the PC. Just recently when I quit out of the game, it caused the monitor to read "input type not supported" until I restarted the graphics drivers. Although if you think of this as part of the game coming to life....maybe you will become more immersed? Just make sure to save before doing anything so you dont lose your progress, and hopefully soon they will patch out the crashing (I think some people are overexxaggerating just how much it crashes, In my 8 hours of play so far, it has actually crashed once.)

There is no way to adjust many setting in game (because they were designed for a console, you could never change these settings in the game themselves) so you have to quit out to adjust anything. Protip: turn on vsync or your screen will tear like paper.

Some people are suggesting to run on an emulator, I would definately NOT suggest this! Almost all the graphical effects and cutscenes run like garbage on an emulator!

Some people are saying the game is too easy on this version...but the game was easy to begin with. Its maybe a little less grindy on this version, but in terms of actual difficulty its more or less the same.

36334830.review:
While I do have that I recommend this game and I personally LOVE everyrthing about it, I DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING IT AT THE MOMENT. If you're going to plug in an Xbox 360 controller into the PC and play it that way, then go for it. But if you aren't going to then I highly recommend to wait on your purchase, and here are my reasons why.

I am a huge fan of the .hack franchise, I played the first volume back around the PS2 days and it was incredible. It will always be my favorite game, and sadly I had to force myself to refund the game. The reasons that I did this were because there are crashing issues and while people are saying this is a good port I must disagree. Unless you have an Xbox controller or use ds4windows with a Playstation controller, the control scheme is very confusing. You do not look around with the mouse at all, only keys on the keyboard which can get pretty annoying and downright frustrating if you're not use to that. The only thing the mouse is good for is left-click for 'A' and right-click for 'B' which is pointless because you can use 'ENTER' and 'BACKSPACE' for both of those. And I couldn't for the life of me understand what the base controls are, and while you CAN madify the control scheme to your liking, I feel that CyberConnect2 needs to make an update where the base controls are much easier to understand and make it easier to change them.
And the crashing issues can most likely be fixed easily by changing one or two lines of code. They weren't even real crashes, more like a softlock during one certain part of the tutorial right after you use your skill attacks. 
All in all I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this title because there is a nice story and it is overall a great experience, but I must say that you should wait on getting the game until they fix the controller scheme if you're going to use the keyboard.

Vol.4のみのプレイの感想ですが、少し短いので、Vol.3.5という名前がしっくり来ます。何か、隠しイベントがあるのでしょうか？？１～３をプレイしたことのないユーザーにはおすすめできます。対して、Vol.４だけが目的という方は、少し物足りないという気持ちになるかもしれません。クリア後のやりこみ要素の追加等、何かアップデートやDLC等の展開があれば良いと思いますが、どうなんでしょうか。
中身のほうは、これぞゲーム、といった感じの爽快感のあるシステムでした。レベルという概念がありながら、作業感等のストレスを感じにくいというのは、良いゲームなんだと思います。

あと、WIN7でのプレイですが、これといった不具合はありませんでした。
コントローラーありきのシステムなので、できれば箱コンがあったほうがいいと思います。しかし、キーボードでは無理、というわけではありません。クリアできます。





最後に、一言申し上げたい。

あの娘と冒険出来ないなんて、そんな殺生な！！！

estas son mis observaciones 
//LO MALO//
*
ahora que el juego se ve mejor y tiene mejor definición se perciben mejor los errores (como la cara de IYoten cuando nos va a matar) al no ser un personaje muy recurrente se lo dejo mal terminado y literalmente parece que llevara una mascara de papel con su cara dibujada en ella (es HORRIBLE)
salvando ese detalle de friki continuo
*
esto no se si ponerlo como malo ya que puede ser del juego o de mi ordenador (así que esta es mas una ACOTACIÓN PERSONAL) el juego en algunas ocasiones se cuelga y solo queda cerrarlo usando el administrador de tareas
*
como ya dije antes que el juego se vea graficamente mejor resalta cosas que hace 10 años dejábamos pasar sin fijarnos mucho y vamos de nuevo con las caras pero ahora CINEMÁTICAS IN GAME cuando los personajes hablan muchas veces vemos como sus bocas no se mueven (y repito esto no era nada hace 10 años pero tras tanto tiempo podría y debería haberse cambiado) no obstante las bocas si se mueven cuando hay un primer plano de su cara (otraves salvo iyoten y asta al principio del juego)
*
el peor punto para mi y en eso tengo que darle la razón a un usuario que leí
el peor punto de todo el juego sin duda es la AUN carencia de traducción al español 
ya ni siquiera pido doblaje solo con que los subtítulos y los menús estén BIEN TRADUCIDOS AL ESPAÑOL eso basta
van cosa de 10 años desde la saga G.U. tiempo mas que muy suficiente para subtitular y hasta doblar los juegos 
MAS con esta clase de juegos en los que la historia es mucho mas que el juego en si es una lastima ya que esto ayudaría muchísimo a su venta (lo cual va a hacer que la franquicia hack/animes/juegos terminen viéndose opacados y dejados atrás por SWORD ART ONLINE cosa que me hace odiarlos mucho mucho mucho de verdad muerte a kirito xD)

*******************************************************************************************************

//LO BUENO//
//Resumen para los que ya jugaron GU 1,2 y 3 en su época//
la fluidez del juego se mejoro incluso mas allá de lo que era su tercer entrega
se agregaron desde el vol1 llamar a los compañeros de party con el LB o L1 (cosa que si no me equivoco era de vol 2 o 3)
la party ya sale a patear chims desde el volumen 1 (se agradece)
la party ahora no conforme con patear chims va a correr a los lucky animals
se mejoro al parecer la IA de la party para defenderse y de algunos enemigos con escudo que ahora se mantienen defendiendo en caso que lo bombardees con golpes
el limitador de CHIMS subió de 99 A 999 (que se agradece infinito) ya saben por el mecha grunty y las puertas
RESUMEN desde el primer juego se nota una mejora muy grande tanto gráfica como en fluidez algunos se llevaran una sorpresa recibiendo mails casi al principio de juego (por donde atoli nos pide ir a 1000 oak´s)

PARA LOS QUE NUNCA JUGARON
es un juego con una historia muy bien echa de principio a fin con personajes muy característicos que evolucionan mediante la historia avanza una calidad gráfica buena (es un remaster bien echo pero tampoco se esperen acá un black desert o algo así) 
una jugabilidad bastante decente fluida y fácil (en ocaciones puede ser muy fácil)
el juego (haber no jugué el 4 ni el nuevo de parody pero por lo menos el 1,2 y3) tienen muchos secretos tanto jefes como personajes
el juego esta mas que completo ya que no solo es un remaster de los primeros 3 hack//G.U sino que también contiene el terminal disc el volumen 4 y un nuevo modo parody(que de momento desconozco totalmente su función)
la banda sonora los va a llevar de la mano de momentos muy épicos llenos de emoción y mucha mucha epicidad sin duda uno de los puntos mas fuertes si no es el mas fuerte de toda la saga HACK//anime/juegos
como dije el juego esta completo y cerrado al vació SIN CAJITAS ALEATORIAS NI ESAS COSAS QUE EXPRIMEN TU BILLETERA
(por ultimo quería decir muerte a kirito larga vida a dot.Hack)
*******************************************************************************************************************************
PESE A LO MALO RECOMIENDO ESTE JUEGO POR SU GRAN CANTIDAD DE COSAS BUENAS NOMBRADAS ANTERIORMENTE AUNQUE NO ME MOLESTA QUIEN NO LO RECOMIENDE POR NO TENER SIQUIERA SUBTÍTULOS EN ESPAÑOL ME PARECE UNA RAZÓN MAS QUE ACEPTABLE.
*********************************************************************************************************************************

36313406.review:
So this is going to be a bit tricky in terms of whether I recommend this or not. On one hand I absolutely adore the .hack series and was really excited when I heard about a remastered version was coming out on Steam. But on the other. . . I'm very unimpressed with this port. Don't misundertand, it boots up and doesn't crash and the graphics resolution is clearly way better than it was on PS2 but just about everything with this "remastered" version screams laziness. The interface is so wonky and not at all designed for a PC and getting back to the main game menu requires restarting the game. Incredibly stupid way to go about things since that's the only way you can change the game to match your screen resolution or activate V-Sync and Jesus are you going to need it. Without V-sync this game tears like crazy. Also, so many of the game asssets weren't upgraded at all when it comes to thier texture resolution. On top of all this if you plug in a controller you have to use an Xbox controller since a play station controller just doesn't work at all. In addition the controller will just randomly stop working and you will have to use keyboard and mouse again and only restarting the game will get the controller to work. Another problem in terms of visuals is the god damned cutscenes, which were not reworked at all, will run fine and then slow to a crawl randomly. No clue why this is happening. I've got a pretty high end rig so this kind of performance dip just makes no sense at all. Very poorly optimized and, overall, it looks like CC2 just went for a quick cash grab with very little effort whatsoever put into making this for PC gamers. So if you have already played the .hack series and have the Ps2 disks . . . use pcsx2 emulator and play them on your PC it will run way better in my experience although you will have to fiddle with the settings to get it just right. If you've never played the series before and don't have a ps2 then this isn't that bad and you might find it to be an amazing game with perhaps a few frustrating caveats with the interface.

Edit: The issue with accessing the steam settings was not well explained on my part. You can get to the title menu from within the game but for whatever reason you cannot change the settings without a restart in my case. Not sure why, hopefully a patch will come out that solves that inconvenience.

Ce jeu est énorme étant jeune j'avais acheté la collection de Hack, qui est pour moi l'un des meilleurs RPG après StarOcéan.
Les graphismes sont mieux qu'à l'époque, le fait de pouvoir rejouer à ce jeu sur PC me rappel la PS2.
Pour les fans qui ont connu la série sortit en 2004 et qui aiment l'univers du RPG ce jeu est génial, très long niveau durée de vie car l'histoire est bien construite, c'est un peu comme SAO pour ceux à qui l'anime dit quelque chose.
Hack reste un jeu immerssif dans le sans ou le fait de jouer dans univers Online on a vraiment l'impression de jouer à un MMO et non plus à un simple RPG car l'interface du jeu est excellente on se croirait vraiment dans un MMORPG avec la boîte email,le site internet du jeu,les films et plein d'autres..(testez le jeu pour comprendre cette phrase xD)

36309566.review:
A great series entry in a franchise that has been very quite outside of Japan for years. 

Pros:
- 60fps gameplay
- Rebalancing of the games 
- Expanded inventory slots, item stacks and chim chims.
- A new part of the game, which while shorter than the others still fits well within the game.
- 3 remastered games in 1 plus the aforementioned new part.
- Allows you to start at any volume you want.
- Allows you to watch the Terminal discs, allowing you to get knowledge of the first 4 games without needing to play them and giving you more in game lore about the series up to its point in the timeline.

Cons:
- Not a perfect port but still playable after you play with the settings. No where near Arkham Knights of broken but some parts like AA seems to really cause issues and somethings just lag no matter what. (Like The Worlds in-game Menu with the forums and The World info)
- The rebalancing can make the game a bit of a cake walk with the right grinding setup as I've managed to get the greatest defense with just the -25% physical attack damage dealt to you making everything do 0 and 1 to me.

Final Thoughts: 
With time the first con can be patched away and even the second one as well but their nothing a PC gamer isn't use to fixing. If you are looking to get into the .hack series for the first time, this is a great point to hop on the game since it does not need any knowledge of the earlier series or other media to .hack. If you are on the fence about this game, just remember it's 3 games for cheaper than what they games sold separate at.

36308164.review:
So far has been a very good port with some minor issues, which I hope get patched.

The game seems to work with PS4 controller, but still uses Xbox icons. The button layout is also strangely flipped, where normally Xbox "A" would be Playstaion "X", "A" instead mapped to the "O" button. So basicly, if you are using a PS4 controller the button inputs are flipped (X and O, Triangle and Square, L1 and L2, R1 and R2, Share and Option). D-pad and analog stick are fine. If you have trouble opening trapped chests with a PS4 controller, try thinking of a Nintendo controller button layout instead of an Xbox.

The game also seems to have some horrible screen tearing, but thankfully that is fixed with V-sync option.

Though, one last major issue... The Anti-Aliasing set to high seems to slow the game down in large areas. This is especially apparent in the main town, Mac Anu. This does not seem to be a frame rate drop, but instead everything just moving twice as slow. I suggest keeping AA to medium setting.

36307262.review:
I was given this game as a gift. I played the original 3 volumes on the PS2 back when they were first released. I love .hack and about every arch that has ever been localized.

.hack//GU is a very different mode from that of the classic series. Where we had actually followed the level headed and intelligent Kite with his partner Blackrose, here we see the angry and irrational Haseo trying to solve his own mysteries. He starts off as a big jerk but character development is pretty kind and makes him a decent person. It's nice to watch em grow up. The cinematics are great and having it in HD with all of the fixes it has needed even back on the PS2 is just phenominal. Combat is fun and only gets better as you get the job extensions. It might not add a whole lot of lore to the .hack series but it does have an interesting story all its own with lovable characters.

i have mostly great things to say about the Remaster having played thru the Orginal series (infection ~ Quarantine) and the PS2 copies of GU. alot of the graphics look well done but some .. only seem like a Upscale almost akin to doing such in PCSX2 with the PS2 versions. (i guess the videos mostly for the Terminal Disc wasnt remade as some dont properly feel up in High Def quality i guess sources were lost over the years ;-; )

Last Recode is going to be a great and Cheap boon for anyone who got screwed out of it in it's orginal release (i know a few countries did mainly the UK got F*d as they only got Infection~Quarantine but got the big finger for GU and only options were importing an NTSC PS2 and copies. and likely an american or Japanese tv as well ((i dont know ? if they had tv's back then that could accept an NTSC 60hz signal) )

but thats not to say the game isnt without it's Nitpicks and faults.  there maybe people who felt thsi is Easy mode (i welcome the rebalance and retry system as back then i was a Codebreaker addict XD and kinda still am.), If you have played it on the PS2 (or did to fill the wait gap in PCSX2 or busted out yer PS2 or BC PS3 fatties) you'll notice the game being faster due to running @ 60FPS and certain sound effects happening more often (Battle grunts etc.) occur way more often. (maybe a PS2 limitation an dthis is how it was intended?)

If you have a standard Cheapie Monitor or play on a semi older tv, (and this is liekly to be the same on the PS4 if it runs at 60FPS as well) is you NEED to have VSync on ingame (if you have an Nvidia GPU also enable Adaptive Vsync this may help w/ older spec machines) otherwise you get Nasty screen tearing (this is what happens on Displays that dont support higher refresh rates or games that render too fast for the Display and causes most or half teh image on 1 frame to be displayed and the next to be drawn at the same time leaving what looks like a gaping line or "Tear" between 2 images)

outside this really have fun w/ the game and just keep an eye out on yoru first few trap chests if you use an Xbox gamepad, the chaneg in button layout will get you offguard and BOOM in teh face ! :p , and the Extra content from Collector editions and what you got in the PS2 version if you imported from a clear save in Quarantine, is nice toop (and that we get localized Parody Mode videos! :D wish they would of added in and localized GU Triliogy's Parody mode :p )

and a side note for UK players or anyone that's forgotten what spell does what until you hit Vol 2, http://dothack.wikia.com/wiki/Spells this is a list of everything from The World R1(Infection~Quarantine) and R2 (GU)

Good luck to everyone out there and just.. dont call Pi an old Hag.

36302904.review:
The Game: It's a PS2 RPG. If you didn't like jRPG's from that era (or at least non-Square Enix RPGs), then this Remaster will not change your mind. If you want to experience a decent MMO genre Anime-storyline though, then this game will let you do so with little work involved if that's all you're looking for.

The Port: (Sidenote: I'm running an i7-4790k and a GTX-970) The textures look great in 1080p and the gameplay framerate has been completely stable at 60fps. There are a lot of nice Quality of Life changes, such as an increased inventory size, faster movement speed, and increased EXP gain. This all makes a lot of sense since this re-release includes every Volume in a single package, so there's no Post-Game after each Volume in the traditional sense where you get your levels and equipment to max in preparation for the next game. Instead of doing that and then waiting a few months, now you finish up the "Post Game" quests, go back to the main menu, select the next Volume and boom. More game.

36299697.review:
I just first would like to say that I never thought the gameplay to the series was all that great. If you're looking for gameplay it's certainly serviceable but not the true appeal of this franchise. The real appeal is how far from the norm the world building is from what you've come to expect with a JRPG. The game gives you a ton of immersion with emails from characters you meet in the world. Interacting random NPCs as if they were players in the MMO, seeing world news events, interacting with forum posts as the games main way of being a wikipedia. It just oozes atmosphere with this believable MMO world. The story also keeps you interested with probably the best character development of any JRPG you're ever going to play. Seeing Haseo grow as a character over the course of 4 games is amazing. Plus the story itself and the side characters will keep your attention throughout its lengthy episode based content.

I would fully recommend this game to anyone, especially this rerelease. The game now runs at a full 60 fps, you can play in full HD, plus they made the game easier for people who want to enjoy the real meat which is the story and for returning veterans. 4 games of 80-90 hours of gameplay for this price is a steal.

36299014.review:
[h1] Welcome to The World. [/h1]


[b] Intro to .hack//Franchise [/b]
For those unfamiliar with the .hack (or dot hack) franchise, I'll start with a basic, spoiler-free introduction. Dot Hack is a now 15 year old multimedia franchise with books, graphic novels, anime, and games, regarding a fictional MMO known simply as The World. This franchise started in the early 2000's, just following the early days of MMOs, inspired by titles such as Ultima Online and Everquest, successful MMOs before World of Warcraft popularized the genre in a more mainstream level.

Each entry in dot hack tells a self-contained story about the fictional MMO and covers topics pertinent to online interactions, online indentities vs. real identities, identity politics, virtual reality, social media, urban legends, and so on. Very forward-thinking for a series conceptualized in the early 2000s. Each entry is also fairly self-contained, not necessarily requiring someone to pay attention to every book, game, anime, or movie to understand the one they are currently on, although consuming more of the franchise does paint a wider picture. It's kind of like Hideo Kojima's Metal Gear franchise in that way.

[b] On to .hack//GU: Last Recode [/b]

This game is a remastered package of .hack//GU, a trilogy of action RPGs for the Playstation 2 console. It is the second series of games in the .hack//Franchise but this is an ideal package to start with. The reason why is that it contains a series of 'Terminal' videos that explain the events of the first game series, so while it's not a replacement for sorely needed remasters or remakes of those games, it's a great alternative to ponying up $200-300 for that series, as it's been long out of print. The videos covering the first games are not necessary to watch for .hack//GU but it provides some extra context and lore for those who care.

As for the game itself, from my experience so far it is a competent port. Not a lot of options on this PC version, but it runs well at seemingly a locked resolution of 60 frames per second, ideal for any high-motion action game. The graphics are way better and less muddy than the PS2 originals, although obviously polygons are still obvious, especially on rounded objects. The style of the graphics are in a cel-shaded style, however, so that aspect has not aged as poorly. You can jump into any Volume you want, including a new 4th Volume created specifically for this remastered set. There is also a parody mode I have no experience with yet, but it allegedly contains spoilers and is not meant for anyone who hasn't completed the games.

The gameplay of .hack//GU: Last Recode is a story-driven action role-playing game, framed as an MMO. You have 'servers' which function as hub towns and another parameter to keep in mind for dungeons. Dungeons are accessed through key words acquired through your player character's emails, the message boards of the world, or story events, and the dungeons generated with the key words change from server to server, so trying the same word combination in different servers will give you different dungeons to complete.

The Server hub worlds themselves are filled with shops, quests, events, and NPCs that roam around as if they were player characters in an MMO, and you can trade with them. A lot of effort was made to try and immerse you in the idea that you're in an MMO. The combat in dungeons is honestly very simple; one attack button, a block button, and skill triggers. It plays out like a basic brawler with repetitive combos. Do not expect depth of gameplay akin to Dark Souls. Dungeons are generated with differing objectives, but honestly from my memory it's just different floor layouts of maybe 3-5 specific types of dungeons with different aesthetic tile sets as you go along to at least change up the visuals from time to time.

If there's two things that make this game (and usually, the entire franchise is strong in these regards), it's the story and the music. If you read my summary of the franchise, the story part wouldn't be too much of a surprise. It holds up pretty well with the topics and themes presented in the plot of these games becoming more and more relevant over the years. Again, I must compare the story to Metal Gear. Specifically, Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty, except with less pseudo-politics on a national scale. The music is very well-composed and catchy in GU, a large improvement over the soundtrack in the original dot hack games in my opinion. Not as stellar as the soundtrack for the first anime, .hack//SIGN, though, but it fits the action of the game well.

[b] Conclusion [/b]

If any of what I have said sounds appealing to you, I would say that this package is worth the price of admission as it is at $50. Previously, the games were only on PS2 with no ports to other systems, and physical copies long out of print and produced in limited numbers in the United States, where I live. Saying that, before this I was only ever able to get the first two volumes, and a complete set nowadays of the physical copies would set you back over $100, WITHOUT the extra volume, Terminal videos recapping the original (also rare) $300 .hack//Games, new stuff like the Parody mode, difficulty options, and upgraded visuals. All that said, you could argue this is a way to get roughly $400 value of previously hard to acquire content at the much cheaper price tag of $50. Although I would still very much like it if Bandai-Namco and CyberConnect2 would just invest in remaking the original dot hack game series already.

If you're on the fence, I would say wait for the eventual steam sales to take their course until you feel ready to take the plunge. This series has a long history and can be overwhelming for newcomers, so buying it on a sale is much less of a risk if you are unsure. As a fan of this often-ignored franchise I would definitely reccommend everyone to give it a try eventually. This franchise is especially fun to people with experience or interest in games and their development, tech, and AI, even if the series often takes creative liberties with the subject matter.

36289458.review:
[h1] 死之恐怖-史凯斯 [/h1]
[h1] 混乱的海市蜃楼-伊尼斯 [/h1]
[h1] 增殖-梅洛斯 [/h1]
[h1] 命运的预言者-费德赫尔 [/h1]
[h1] 策谋家-洛雷 [/h1]

[h1] 复仇者-塔努诺斯 [/h1]
[h1] 再诞-克尔佩尼格 [/h1]

好了，说说我想说的。从初中开始，第一次被朋友安利hack系列（那个时候还有个名字叫：创世纪）之后便深深的被这部神作吸引。玩通三部曲之后，hack//g.u成为我永心中中永远不可超越的游戏。hack系列开创了网游背景系列的先河，剧情在当时既新颖又经典。只恨这种作品生不逢时，只有当年的我们凭借淘游戏的热情和怼日文的毅力才能发掘出来。以我观点而言，相比现在的刀剑，剧情完整度，内涵，人设，都不是一个档次的。当然我也看刀剑，不过我个人还是顶hack。不仅仅好坏之分，而是感动之差。

想想从我第一次玩 HACK//G.U 已经12年了，快奔三的我依稀还在为这个游戏而中二，各种游戏的名字，账号，无论哪里都会刻下这个名字。记得以前玩FF14的时候走在路上，有人对我发了句：志乃？我立马回应G.U。对方心领神会，这是多么默契的感觉。在现在大作盲目追，冷饭没人炒的商业年代，可能已经没有这种感觉了吧。

当尾声的时候，HASEO说出了那句：我不再是死の恐怖了，我要拯救你，ovan。我觉得无论哪个玩家，精神应该都会为之升华。就像现在奔三的我，早已不是那个时候的愣头青年，走过多少错路，热血过，失败过，骂过那些管着你的人。但是，那些人依旧会指引你，当你重生为白色之时，你会理解他们，并且回头拯救那些拯救过你的人。

     永远的PKK，133级HASEO，死の恐怖。

我会在我不大的圈子里推这款游戏，希望更多的人了解这部作品。


心里的中二言论：[spoiler]（hack系列完爆所有游戏，我不是针对刀剑，我是说什么黑魂，P5，尼尔，总之在座的所有游戏都是垃圾！）[/spoiler]

还未开玩，用以前的三部曲来评价的话

剧情 10分

人设 10分

画面 8分

音乐 10分

战斗 9分

这次重置应该是全满分了

[spoiler] 顺带一提我最喜欢的是摇光！那个爱的羁绊脸红真是太棒了！[/spoiler]

PS:三个大妈已经有中文，留言有下载，真是太感谢大佬们的付出。另外还有，如果有喜爱这个游戏的新玩家，建议去补一下动画.hack//roots虽然质量不高，但是却是为了理解所有剧情必不可少的动画，否则里面很多东西是看不懂的

36289160.review:
1時間ほどプレイしました。

プレイしはじめはティアリングが酷かったのですが、オプションに垂直同期の項目があるのでまずチェックを入れるべきです。

映像はPS2当時と比較すると非常に綺麗になっています。
しかしその分リアルタイムレンダリングではちゃちさが目立つところもあります。
現代のゲームと比較すると、映像（ポリゴン）が同じ程度綺麗なのに、
キャラの表情が変わらなかったり口が動かないのにセリフが流れたりという点が気になる人もいるかもしれません。
エフェクトの面でも、現代のゲームによくあるパーティクルの表現がないところが時代を感じます。

フレームレートが向上しています。
ロード画面の緑の円が動くところで既に実感できると思います。
スキルトリガーでアーツを発動したときも明らかに滑らかなモーションを感じられます。
街中やダンジョン、フィールドを移動しているときもフレームレートの違いが判るでしょう。

PS4のコントローラーを有線で繋いでプレイしていますが、おかしな挙動もなく安定して遊べます。
ただし、十字キーは使えないようです。
すべてスティック操作をしなければならないのは不便かと思います。
慣れてしまえばそれまでかもしれません。

総合して、.hack//G.U.に思い入れのある人なら購入して損はないでしょう。
値段は少し張りますが、PCでプレイできること、vol1～vol3でディスクを入れ替えないでいいことを考えたら価値はあります。

36277104.review:
以前没有ps2玩，但是通过杂志知道的作品。当时出过GU的前传TV动画，后来真喜欢这个作品是从CG剧场版开始的。现在玩得不久，但是CC2的过场真是很不错。

vol.1通关了，说下感受吧。
首先这游戏剧情部分比游戏部分（战斗和探索）更为侧重。整个游戏剧情包括过场演出说真的，其他大部分的日系RPG都做不到这种程度，而且这是10年前的作品（这里特指是G.U.，.hack//系列是15年前）啊。但是由于这种侧重，游戏部分（战斗和探索）反而薄弱，感觉后面3章也差不多情况。游戏部分薄弱主要体现是战斗难度简单，可探索元素较少。虽然这样说，但是因此换来的是升级不花时间，达到一定等级打boss就继续看精彩剧情了。只不过这样的话实在会对某些喜欢玩的玩家造成不满。
只不过，真的，我强力推荐啦。
后面的我会继续写下去的，就是不会太肝了，毕竟有工作啊。

补充：
终于全部通关了。从剧情上看的话，vol.2和vol.3实际单独来看，比不上vol.1啦。vol.2和vol.3长度合起来大概是vol.1的1.5倍，加上vol.2的留底和vol.3的早期紧接，如果不将两作一起来玩，vol.2和vol.3的单独评价是很差的。还有大概是看过剧场版的缘故吧，实际游戏上的演出其实是不达标的，但是相对来说剧情完整啊，算是有利有弊。
vol.2和vol.3的战斗系统是有改善的，却也有迷宫过长的现象。而且失落武器的收集是硬性第延长游戏体现，但本身游戏难度就低，失落武器可有可无的。boss战方面，vol.2和vol.3比vol.1更多可圈可点的，尤其是vol.3,有几场boss战还是难度挺大的，但相对来说却做得不错，有挑战性。
而队友AI的问题，其实这个当游戏难度偏低的时候，猪队友就不是问题了。所以感觉当时制作组就是刻意为之。要知道hack系列这种队友设计，在今天的FF15也是有出现，而且其实也是很容易死的。。。。。。。。所以10年前还可以原谅，今天就是陈年问题了。
vol.4单独拿出来说，主要是这个是10周年的新章，起码是最近两三年新做的。因此有不少亮点。主角第5形态的建模，手指不少方块手指，而且分开的（OVAN也是）。新章的语音一口气从vol.1玩下来，还是那种味道实属厉害啊，日本声优（可以说这批当年还不算大红大紫的，今天基本是一哥一姐的地位了）。过场基本是新技术的CG制作，效果真不一般。缺点是剧情真的短，只是官方给出了个真结局。

总的来说，.hack//G.U.系列是一款讲故事为主，战斗为辅的JRPG。虽然多少有些中二成分，却在很多方面糅合出一种动漫神作的气质。如果没接触过这部作品，又喜欢看动漫的朋友，我觉得值得推荐你去玩。

PS：vol.4结局留下的话其实有点深意啊，希望这句话真的暗示续作
        对于新人想做个提醒，.hack系列比SAO和记录的地平线还早的，以网游游戏为背景的游戏作
        品。是不是鼻    祖不清楚，但是其影响力可以说很早就有。所以不要傻傻分不清先和后。

Mapping xbox controls to get full experience

This beats Sword Art Online games in my opinion, absolutely love this game from the Volume 1, to Volume 4.

36275354.review:
So, I'm not one of the people that played this game when I was younger. I played a large portion of PS2 games, but I was never able to find a copy of these.

I plan on updating my review as time goes on, as this review would have to cover what this product is in it's entirety, and that spans four games.

Currently I'm 5 hours into the first game, and I have to admit, I'm horribly bored. I bought it because I've always heard a ton of great things about the game, but thus far it's been 90% cutscenes, and I feel like after five hours the story is moving, but I just haven't done anything. I can't even do any side quests yet until I progress further, aside from the first one. I'm sticking with it in the hopes that it picks up, by the second game at the very least.

As it currently stands thus far into the game, I have no problem with the visuals, as I feel they have been updated very nicely. Gameplay is pretty standard for what I'd expect and the game runs fabulously. However, as I have yet to be able to enjoy myself, I'll have to give the game a thumbs down at this point in time. If there was a neutral button, I would definitely choose that option, but I cannot give it a thumbs up at this point in time. Really hoping it picks up, though. I enjoy the cutscenes, for what they're worth.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So, as of now I have about 24 hours into the game and have completed the first of the four games bundled. I still hold onto what was stated above, and the first 5-6 hours of the game felt dragged out and awfully slow. In about that time I think I actually played the game a total of ten minutes. Having never played this game before, and not having the nostalgia many others are basing their reviews off of, it was pretty difficult to force myself through the beginning of the first game. however, shortly after that 6 hour mark you get thrusted into the Arena and the game finally lets you free and I had an absolute blast.

The game mechanics, though outdated, were still fun and engaging regardless of how many times I repeated the same thing (in perfect MMO fashion). The whole "online aspect" of the game was a wonderful experience, and seeing how modern the game is despite coming out over a decade ago really shows the vision that went into this. They basically predicted current online play to a T. Building relationships and watching the characters grow and bond was a great experience, I just wish they could have blend the combat and cutscenes together better to make it more enjoyable.
Another negative thing I found about the first game is how frustratingly easy it was. Before I was even halfway through the game I was already capped at 50 basically one-shotting everything. To a degree it was my fault, but I didn't realize how quickly I would level up or how quick the level cap would approach.

I've just begun the second game and I have to admit, I am thoroughly excited to see where this goes. I would now definitely recommend this bundle of .Hack//G.U. games, especially if the rest of the games continue to improve at this rate as well.

🕹️- Nesse game temos o nosso protagonista chamado Haseo, que esta a procura de um jogador misterioso chamado de Tri-Edge, que supostamente atacou e deixou a sua amiga Shino em coma. 

🕹️- Com isso, Haseo começa a sua jornada no jogo online para vingar o coma deixado pelo Tri-Edge, mas não são os ataques inimigos que causam o coma, e sim a infecção do Aida nos players.

🕹️- Positivo - Sua magnífica existência
 
🕹️- Negativo - Falta mais games de qualidade no mundo gamer atualmente

36275018.review:
Highly recommended if you are a fan of the series. Also recommend it if you are a fan of SAO. This (imo) has a superior story, and better characters overall.

Honestly, the price is fair considering it's 3-games-in-1 package plus extra content, enhanced graphics, and gameplay.
If you've played the trilogy before, this is the best way to go through it again. There's even an optional "cheat mode" if you just want to go through the story. [spoiler] The 4th volume also ties the loose ends, and resolves the cliffhanger at the end of Vol. 3.[/spoiler]

If you're unfamiliar to the series, I recommend it as well if you like JRPG's with good stories and music. The gameplay isn't the strongest point of this game, but I feel like it suits this type of game. It's not bad by any means, but I feel it could have been better.

For a 2006 PS2 game, I think overall, it aged pretty well, especially with the enhancements. Going through the game again, it's still fun.

Also important to note: A controller is highly recommended if you plan to buy this game.

หนึ่งในต้นตำหรับเรื่องที่เนื้อหาแนวตัวเอกเล่นเกมส์
ภาค G.U. จะเรียกว่าเป็นเกมส์ภาคหลัก ภาคที่ 2 ก็ได้ แต่ไม่จำเป็นต้องเล่นภาคแรกมาก่อน ก็สามารถเล่นได้อรรถรส
แต่ถ้าใครเล่นภาคแรกมา จะได้อรรถรสมากกว่าเดิม เพราะมี Lore ที่เชื่อมกับภาคแรกเยอะสุดๆ 
(สามารถดูโหมด Terminal disc เพื่อช่วยให้รู้เนื้อเรื่องภาคแรกได้)


+ระบบต่อสู้ ก็เพลินๆง่ายๆ ต้องค่อยๆเล่นจากบทแรกไป เพราะระบบสนุกๆกับท่าเท่ห์ๆจะค่อยๆปลดล็อค
+สิ่งที่มีให้ทำในเกมส์ ผมคิดว่ากำลังดี ไม่เยอะไป ไม่น้อยไป เพราะมันจำกัดเลเวลในแต่ละบท
+เนื้อเรื่องเข้มข้น และซีเรียส ค่อยๆคลายปมได้มันส์ดี จบบท 1 กับ 2 ได้พีคมาก
+เพลงเพราะมากกกกกกก
+ที่เด็ดสุดคือเราสามารถแต่งงานกับเพื่อนทุกคนในเฟรนลิสของเราได้ในบทที่3(ทั้งชายและหญิง) 
ทำให้เราสามารถเลือกไวฟุได้ตามสเป็คของเรา

-พอร์ทยังไม่ดี มีบัคเกมส์เด้งที่หาสาเหตุยังไม่ได้ เป็นกับบางคน (ผมเป็นนะ)
เพื่อความชัวร์ รอแพทช์ก่อนก็ได้ ไม่ก็รอผู้เล่นท่านอื่นหาสาเหตุก่อน
-พออัพเป็น 60fps (เวอร์ชั่นps2 แค่30fps) ดูสปีดการวิ่งหรือบางแอ็คชั่นแปลกๆ

เรื่องย่อ
ฮาเซโอ เข้ามาในโลกแห่งเกมส์ที่มีนามว่า The world:R2 แต่เพิ่งเข้าเกมส์ เค้าก็ถูกพวก PK (Player killer) หลอกไปฆ่าตั้งแต่เริ่ม
ที่นั่นเค้าได้รับการช่วยเหลือจากโอวาน ชายปริศนาที่มีแขนยักษ์
ผ่านไป 8 เดือน ฮาเซโอได้เติบโตขึ้นในฐานะ PKK (Player killer killer หรือเป็น นักฆ่าพวกPK) ที่ถูกขนานนามว่า Terror of Death
เพื่อตามหา PK ในตำนานที่ชื่อว่า "ไทร-เอดจ์"
ว่ากันว่าใครก็ตามที่ถูก ไทรเอดจ์จัดการ จะหายไปจาก The world และไม่ได้ฟื้นขึ้นในโลกแห่งความจริงด้วย 
ซึ่งหนึ่งในเหยื่อของ ไทรเอดจ์ คือ เพื่อนสนิทในช่วง8เดือนที่ผ่านมาของฮาเซโอ ชื่อว่า"ชิโนะ"  
ฮาเซโอจึงเป็น PKK เพื่อหาตัวไทรเอดจ์ และช่วยชิโนะให้ฟื้นกลับมา
ทว่าเมื่อหาตัวไทรเอดจ์พบ ฮาเซโอกลับพลาดท่าให้กับไทรเอดจ์ และโดนท่าแปลกๆ ทำให้เลเวลของฮาเซโอกลับไปเริ่มที่ เลเวล1 ใหม่อีกครั้ง
ฮาเซโอจึงต้องเริ่มจากศูนย์ เพื่อตามหาไทรเอดจ์ และไขปริศนาสิ่งแปลกปลอมที่เกิดขึ้นกับตัวละครของเขาด้วย

36267433.review:
.hack! Oh man, I spent so much of my childhood running Kite and Blackrose through dungeons on my old PS2, that to have the chance of playing the GU series is a true joy that resonates with me. This remastered of the three GU games is excellent. Playing on a 4k TV, I am able to see the difference between this and the PS2 versions like night and day. Movies are smooth and the controller inputs feel crisp.

One negative I have is the speed of the game seems to have been amped to X1.25. Its okay because alot of times you're running and it certainly gets you there quicker but  yeah its noticeable. This is only in free run situations, dialogue and movies are normal, or else they'd sound like chipmonks. I also had trouble initially with frame rate stuttering but I had to assign my Graphics card to handle the game application v integrated video chip.

Definitely recommend this series to veterans of the original games and to those who have had the GU series before. To newcomers, this is a GREAT chance to experience the second half of the .hack franchise that the PS2 offered. It really has a style and story that you'll love.

まず、15分置きに強制終了してしまう場合の対処法から。
１）Win10の場合、『スタートボタン』を右クリックして『コンピューターの管理』を開く。
２）『サービス』を開く（ない場合は『サービスとアプリケーション』の左側にある『＞』を押すと出てきます）
３）『Touch Keyboard and Handwriting Panel Service』を右クリックして『プロパティ』を選択
４）『スタートアップの種類』を『無効』に変更し、『サービスの状態』を『停止』に変更。
これで、15分置きの強制終了は起きなくなるはず。起きたらゴメン。

ゲームの方は、Vol4だけで考えると正直もう少しボリュームが欲しかったところ。
４時間弱でクリアし、お楽しみ要素はあまりなさそう。
チートモードがあるけれど、それがなくても大分無双状態。
ただやっぱりストーリーはいいし、.hackファンとして、この作品をプレイできたのはやっぱりうれしかった！

.hackを知らない人には、Vol1~4までプレイできるのでオススメ（Vol1~3は長いし、お楽しみ要素も充実してます）
.hackをやったことがある人、.hackファンには、ストーリーを楽しみたいならオススメ。

36261126.review:
dotHack//GU Last Recode is a classic JRPG. Its well worth the asking price as its 3 games bundled into one with an additional  new content release. The old games have been remastered, and done so quite well. That being said however there seems to be some visual errors and lack of mouse and keyboard support for the PC title (keyboard only)....but this isn't game breaking. At its core, its a faux MMORPG, and it nails this perfectly....especially when you consider how old the title is....and creates a great single player experience.

This release should be treated as both a beloved franchise and a potential fundraiser for future titles from the same developer. Is it debateable whether the original 4 dotHack games were more deserving of a remaster (I personally believed them to be the better games, but to each their own), regardless this titles success and early adoption by consumers will help fund its port and further new titles.

In short I fully recommend this game. Its aged like a fine wine, sure its a little grindy, but most JRPGs are, and with potential mod support....well the future looks bright for this game. Its funny we now live in a time where I have a VR headset and am playing the dotHack franchise on PC...were some argue it should have been from the get go.

Lets give this game the support it deserves.

Cons:

I fully recommend buying this game as (at least for me) it works flawlessly, even on a Toaster of PC. Doing so you're supporting the .hack// Games scene, making CyberConnect2 think about fully porting some other .hack// titles to PC or making new .hack// Games altogether.

36258565.review:
I'm a longtime fan of the .hack series to the point where you could call me a fanboy. I have criticisms of the first four games (.hack Infection, Mutation, Outbreak and Quarantine) mostly for being so stale and grindy. That being said, this is a detail-oriented review that seeks to answer questions like "Do I need to play the original series to understand this one?" So if you don't enjoy walls of text or you just want a direct review of THIS game ONLY, skip it.

The game has a complex story, so I'll try to simplify it.

Mild story spoilers ahead.

-----------------------------------------

If you haven't played a .hack game before, this is a great place to start. The game includes an "OS Terminal" that has a bunch of videos which will catch new players up with what they missed in the first four PS2 games, and while they're a bit slow and tedious to sit through, it sure as hell beats buying the original games for about $400 collectively and spending 2 weeks grinding through the story.

.hack//G.U. is an offline, single-player game that emulates the atmosphere and features of an actual MMORPG. It was designed back in 2006 for players that wanted an online game but couldn't justify paying $15 a month to play. It emulates a lot of the aesthetic of early Everquest stylings while also adding more modern sci-fi/hacking themes. If you like anything cyberpunk or futuristic mixed with high-fantasy medieval tones, you'll love .hack//G.U.

For clarification, the G.U. series on PS2 had 3 parts: Volume 1: Rebirth, Volume 2: Reminisce, and Volume 3: Redemption, which is a sequel to the IMOQ series mentioned above. This version, Last Recode, not only remastered the original PS2 series, it actually ADDED Volume 4 that included cut content from the original final game, complete with returning voice actors, new abilities/story quests and so on. It's kind of mind-blowing that a publisher would ADD NEW CONTENT to an old niche PS2 game and remaster it for current-gen consoles and PCs. That fact alone is worth the price of admission.

The story is very enigmatic and dramatic. I love cheesy anime drama stories, but this game takes it to the next level. There's a lot of screaming, death, romance, revenge, and everything else you might expect from a typical shounen anime. As a 16-year-old back in the day, this was really cool to me. As an adult, I acknowledge all the cliche's but I still love it.

In the original .hack PS2 series, the protagonist player named Kite logged in to play an MMO known plainly as "The World" (this was before all the cancerous Jojo memes, for the record) with his friend Yasuhiko who controls his character named Orca, a high-level and famous player. After a basic tutorial and a run-through of the combat and dungeon, Kite and Orca suddenly get teleported to an area where a mysterious white-haired, angelic-looking girl named Aura hands him an item called the Book of Twilight. She vanishes and a monster appears known as "Skeith," whom uses an ability on Orca known as "Data Drain," which kills him and puts Yasuhiko into a coma. Kite gets teleported out of the battleground thanks to the help of a hacker known as Helba, and he remarks that he doesn't know what happened to his friend, as he vows to explore the mysteries hidden within the world.

As he searches deeply for clues as to why a game can put a real life person into a coma, he looks to the forums for help, as he poses the question of whether or not anyone else heard of this coma phenomenon. When he goes back later to check, he finds his post deleted. The game progresses and it becomes clear that the system administrators of the game are aware of the problem but are trying to cover up the truth by censoring any of the discussion about the issue. If you want to find out the rest of the story, there are plenty of story cutscenes available on YouTube as well as within .hack//G.U. Last Recode's files, but if you like murder mystery or psychological horror, you've come to the right place.

Within the context of the first four games, the fear of that sort of thing happening once again is due to an event known as "Pluto's Kiss," in which a hacker shut down every computer in the world, arming the US's missile defense retaliation system and nearly ending the world before it was stopped at the last second. This is a fictional world in which fear of AI and network security is a very real thing that mirror's our own world's politics. There are news apps that update you on events going on in the real world within the game and multiple parallel stories (such as a documentary series known as "Online Jack" that takes place concurrently to the game's events) to give the illusion that this online game is both alive and impactful. In the first 4 games in the series, the games came with a DVD OVA known as ".hack//LIMINALITY" that also used a concurrent real-life story to supplement the in-game plot; the idea that everything happening in the game is making an impact on the real world in real time - a super interesting concept.

.hack//G.U. takes place after the initial four games, and it's a massive improvement. There's more action, better graphics, more polished voice acting and gameplay. If you feel the need to replay the original series in order to enjoy this one, don't. Aside from some narrative caveats, this is a fully-functioning standalone game that has nods and returning characters from the original series, but you won't miss much if you just watch a recap.

-----------------------------------------

.hack//G.U. stars a player known as Haseo who starts off as an idealistic youth engulfed with angst and vengeance, and I'll be honest, he's a huge d-bag that most players will find brash, unlikeable, and incredibly toxic. He thinks he's the best, he talks down to people who try to help him, and he's just plain rude. As the game progresses, however, he becomes completely redeemable as he matures in response to the tribulations he faces in The World. His primary motivation is, much like the last game, to unearth the mystery behind his friend Shino being killed by a hacker and put into a coma in real-life, but this time there's romance involved between the two. If you're interested in exploring the preceding events of G.U., check out the anime .hack//Roots, which is a prequel that takes place in the same universe with most of the same characters.

Haseo, like Kite before him, inherits a character with hacking skills. Within the context of the story, you're a hacker playing in a world full of normal, law-abiding players. You're basically a Gary Stu (aka male Mary Sue) who's stronger than everyone and the story revolves around you. Along the way you'll encounter a wide variety of interesting characters, like Sakubo, a player character shared by a timid little brother and a tsundere little sister, Saku and Bo, respectively. When you invite her to your party, there's a 50/50 chance of getting either one. You'll meet Piros the Third, who's actually based on the president of the publishing/developer company CyberConnect2, an eccentric roleplayer who never breaks character and acts incredibly cheesy and overly heroic. You'll meet a large beastman-character named Gabi, who, in real life, is a novelist and retired professor of cultural anthropology, who's so busy that he makes it a habit to respond to questions with only a one-line, several-word response usually accompanied by a smiley face. :) You'll also meet familiar faces from the first game, some of which have gone rogue and become the central antagonists.

I could go on and on and on about this series and why I adore it. The artists and composers are responsible for Ghost in the Shell and Evangelion among other things. If you like this game, watch the anime series. Read the wiki. It's a deep, never-ending mysterious series that treats the player like an intelligent adult. It's my #1 RPG series of all time and if you like these kinds of games, you'll love Last Recode!

36258460.review:
Long time .hack fan here and I will try and be as objective as possible with this review as I may be, of course, a bit biased.

I first picked up .hack//GU Vol 2 in a hand me down game store back in 2008, having no idea what .hack was or what I was getting into.

After some research I discovered the series and the rich, deep background of everything .hack

If you are looking for lengthy gameplay, deep story, and a variety of emotions, this is your game.
The game also has a great completionist aspect to it for those of you that are into that. The data from one game feeds into the next and special items and levels are awarded in each consecutive game. The story is of course ongoing, but so is your progress which makes the investment worth it.

The game at times feels like a real MMO (long time Guild Wars and Guild Wars 2 player). The BBS, world news, community, email, and desktop give you a real illusion of playing a real online game. It's very easy to become connected to the characters and shocking when you realize they are AIs.

The graphics are greatly enchanced from the original PS2 games while staying true to the original feel. Bandai/Namco did a great job of cleaning up the fuzziness and also increasing the scope of the characters expressions.

The music is of course as great as always and if you haven't already I highly encourage purchasing the sounds tracks.

.hack//GU Last Recode has it all. Highly encourage this purchase.
